intro: Crucifera matronalis, commonly known as the noble mustard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive cruciform flowers, which typically have four petals arranged in a cross shape. The plant produces small, rounded pods that contain several seeds, and it thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. Its leaves are usually lobed and can vary in size depending on the growing conditions. This species is often cultivated for both ornamental purposes and as a source of edible seeds.
